content: It’s not that learning is useless and we should stop educating ourselves. There are many situations in which you do need to learn something before attempting it. I believe the problem is decision fatigue by the sheer volume of voices available on every subject. How does one know which is the “best” way? The key point is to stop obsessively researching for the “perfect” way to the end goal. Find one way and simply begin. You can always adjust course later.
